Summary In the workplace, I learn quickly and care about success. I am the type of person who enjoys taking on the big challenges and keeps the stress level low. I want my workplace to be something I look forward to going and feel like I have an impact there. My objectives include continuing to learn on the job or in training, teaching in the workplace and at school, and to grow as an employee. Experience Teacher Foothill-De Anza Community College District March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Cupertino I teach Immuno/hematology lab once a year at De Anza Clinical laboratory scientist Stanford University October 2011  – Present (3 years 11 months) I work in a HLA Laboratory. This means matching patients and donors for transplantation as well as monitoring patients before and after transplant. Often there are severe time limitations, high stress, and a focus on accuracy. Main responsibilities include: low and high resolution sequencing (SSP, SSOP, Sequencing), antibody identification and strength, flow crossmatching between cells and serum, QC, troubleshooting, inventory, and education. I work with several robots and many different software platforms.
